name: Aloo Pulao
ingredients: rice, potato, onion, cumin, green chili, salt, turmeric, oil
instructions:
1. Wash and soak 1 cup of rice for 20 minutes.
2. Peel and dice 2 potatoes.
3. Slice 1 onion and 2 green chilies.
4. Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds.
5. Add onion and chilies. Sauté until golden.
6. Add potatoes, turmeric, salt. Cook for 5 minutes.
7. Add rice and 2 cups water. Mix well.
8. Cover and cook on low heat for 15 minutes.

name: Veg Fried Rice
ingredients: rice, carrot, capsicum, beans, soy sauce, pepper, salt, oil
instructions:
1. Cook 1 cup rice and cool it.
2. Finely chop carrot, capsicum, and beans.
3. Heat 2 tbsp oil in a wok. Add all veggies.
4. Stir fry for 4-5 minutes on high flame.
5. Add cooked rice, 2 tsp soy sauce, salt and pepper.
6. Mix and fry everything for 2-3 minutes.

name: Onion Pakoda
ingredients: onion, gram flour, chili powder, coriander, salt, oil
instructions:
1. Thinly slice 2 onions.
2. Mix with 1 cup gram flour, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp salt, chopped coriander.
3. Add little water to form a thick batter.
4. Heat oil in a pan.
5. Drop spoonfuls into oil and deep fry till golden.

name: Potato Curry
ingredients: potato, tomato, onion, mustard seeds, salt, turmeric, oil
instructions:
1. Boil and peel 3 potatoes, cut into cubes.
2. Heat 2 tbsp oil. Add mustard seeds.
3. Add chopped onion and cook till translucent.
4. Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, and salt.
5. Cook until tomatoes are mushy.
6. Add potatoes. Cook for 5 minutes. Add water if needed.

name: Tomato Rice
ingredients: rice, tomato, onion, mustard seeds, curry leaves, salt, turmeric, oil
instructions:
1. Cook 1 cup rice and keep aside.
2. Heat 2 tbsp oil. Add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
3. Add chopped onions and sauté till golden.
4. Add chopped tomatoes, salt and turmeric.
5. Cook till tomatoes soften.
6. Mix in the rice. Stir fry for 2 minutes.

name: Masala Khichdi
ingredients: rice, moong dal, onion, ginger, turmeric, cumin, garam masala, oil
instructions:
1. Wash 1/2 cup rice and 1/4 cup moong dal. Soak for 30 mins.
2. Heat oil. Add cumin seeds, chopped onion, ginger.
3. Sauté till golden. Add turmeric, garam masala.
4. Add soaked rice and dal. Mix well.
5. Add 3 cups water. Cook on low heat for 20 mins.

name: Paneer Butter Masala
ingredients: paneer, tomato, onion, cream, butter, garam masala, kasuri methi
instructions:
1. Blend tomatoes and onions to make smooth paste.
2. Heat butter in pan. Add the paste and cook for 5 mins.
3. Add garam masala, salt and 1/2 cup water.
4. Add paneer cubes. Simmer for 5 mins.
5. Add cream and crushed kasuri methi. Mix well.

name: Chana Masala
ingredients: chickpeas, tomato, onion, ginger, garlic, garam masala, amchur, oil
instructions:
1. Pressure cook 1 cup chickpeas with salt. Set aside.
2. Heat oil. Add chopped onion, ginger, garlic. Sauté.
3. Add tomato puree, garam masala, amchur powder.
4. Cook for 5 mins. Add boiled chickpeas.
5. Mix and cook for another 5 mins.

name: Palak Paneer
ingredients: paneer, spinach, onion, garlic, ginger, garam masala, cream, butter, salt, oil
instructions:
1. Blanch 500g spinach in boiling water for 2 minutes. Blend to smooth puree.
2. Cut 200g paneer into cubes.
3. Heat 2 tbsp oil and 1 tbsp butter in a pan. Add chopped onion, garlic, ginger.
4. Sauté until golden brown.
5. Add spinach puree, garam masala, and salt.
6. Cook for 5 minutes on medium heat.
7. Add paneer cubes and 2 tbsp cream.
8. Simmer for 3 minutes. Garnish with cream.

name: Dal Tadka
ingredients: toor dal, onion, tomato, garlic, ginger, turmeric, cumin, mustard seeds, red chili, garam masala, cilantro, oil
instructions:
1. Wash and pressure cook 1 cup toor dal with turmeric and salt for 5 whistles.
2. Heat 2 tbsp oil in a tadka pan. Add mustard seeds and cumin.
3. Add chopped onion, garlic, and ginger. Fry until golden.
4. Add chopped tomato and red chili. Cook until soft.
5. Add garam masala and 1/2 cup water.
6. Pour the tadka over cooked dal.
7. Garnish with fresh cilantro.

name: Jeera Rice
ingredients: rice, cumin seeds, bay leaf, cinnamon, cardamom, onion, salt, oil
instructions:
1. Wash and cook 1 cup basmati rice with enough water.
2. Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds, bay leaf, cinnamon, and cardamom.
3. Add thinly sliced onion. Fry until golden brown.
4. Add cooked rice and salt.
5. Mix gently and cook for 2 minutes on low heat.

name: Butter Chicken
ingredients: chicken, tomato, onion, cream, butter, ginger, garlic, garam masala, kasuri methi, salt, oil
instructions:
1. Marinate 500g chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for 1 hour.
2. Grill or pan-fry chicken until cooked.
3. Heat butter in a pan. Add chopped onion, ginger, garlic.
4. Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
5. Add garam masala, salt, and 1/2 cup water.
6. Add grilled chicken and simmer for 5 minutes.
7. Add cream and crushed kasuri methi.
8. Cook for 2 minutes. Garnish with cream.

name: Vegetable Biryani
ingredients: rice, mixed vegetables, onion, tomato, mint, cilantro, biryani masala, saffron, yogurt, ghee
instructions:
1. Soak 1 cup basmati rice for 30 minutes.
2. Heat ghee in a pan. Add sliced onions and fry until golden.
3. Add chopped tomatoes, mixed vegetables, and biryani masala.
4. Cook for 5 minutes. Add yogurt and herbs.
5. Layer half cooked rice with vegetable mixture.
6. Top with saffron milk and fried onions.
7. Dum cook covered for 20 minutes.

name: Egg Curry
ingredients: eggs, onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, cream, oil
instructions:
1. Hard boil 6 eggs and make slits on the surface.
2. Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan. Add chopped onion, ginger, garlic.
3. Sauté until golden. Add tomato puree.
4. Add turmeric, red chili powder, and garam masala.
5. Cook until oil separates. Add 1/2 cup water.
6. Add boiled eggs and simmer for 5 minutes.
7. Add cream and cook for 2 minutes.

name: Mushroom Masala
ingredients: mushrooms, onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, garam masala, cream, butter, salt, oil
instructions:
1. Clean and slice 300g mushrooms.
2. Heat 2 tbsp oil and 1 tbsp butter in a pan.
3. Add chopped onion, ginger, garlic. Sauté until golden.
4. Add sliced mushrooms and cook until golden.
5. Add tomato puree, garam masala, and salt.
6. Cook for 5 minutes. Add cream.
7. Simmer for 3 minutes. Garnish with cream.

name: Pav Bhaji
ingredients: potatoes, cauliflower, peas, onion, tomato, pav bhaji masala, butter, lemon, cilantro
instructions:
1. Boil and mash 2 potatoes and 1/2 cup cauliflower.
2. Heat butter in a pan. Add chopped onion and cook until golden.
3. Add tomatoes and pav bhaji masala. Cook until soft.
4. Add mashed vegetables and 1/2 cup water.
5. Mash everything together and cook for 5 minutes.
6. Serve with buttered pav and lemon wedges.

name: Rajma
ingredients: kidney beans, onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, cumin, coriander powder, garam masala, oil
instructions:
1. Soak 1 cup kidney beans overnight. Pressure cook until soft.
2. Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds.
3. Add chopped onion, ginger, garlic. Sauté until golden.
4. Add tomato puree, coriander powder, and garam masala.
5. Cook until oil separates. Add cooked rajma and 1 cup water.
6. Simmer for 15 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

name: Gobi Manchurian
ingredients: cauliflower, ginger, garlic, soy sauce, vinegar, corn flour, green chilies, spring onions, oil
instructions:
1. Cut cauliflower into florets. Coat with corn flour and deep fry until golden.
2. Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan. Add minced ginger, garlic, and green chilies.
3. Add soy sauce, vinegar, and 2 tbsp water.
4. Add fried cauliflower and toss well.
5. Garnish with spring onions.

name: Veg Momos
ingredients: flour, cabbage, carrot, onion, ginger, garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, spring onions
instructions:
1. Make dough with flour and water. Rest for 30 minutes.
2. Finely chop cabbage, carrot, and onion.
3. Mix with ginger, garlic, soy sauce, and sesame oil.
4. Roll dough into circles. Fill with mixture and pleat edges.
5. Steam for 15 minutes. Serve with dipping sauce.

name: Spring Rolls
ingredients: flour, cabbage, carrot, bean sprouts, soy sauce, vinegar, oil
instructions:
1. Make wrapper dough with flour and water.
2. Finely chop vegetables and mix with soy sauce and vinegar.
3. Roll wrappers thinly. Place filling and roll tightly.
4. Deep fry until golden and crispy.

name: Dosa
ingredients: rice, urad dal, fenugreek seeds, salt, oil
instructions:
1. Soak 3 cups rice, 1 cup urad dal, and 1 tsp fenugreek separately for 4 hours.
2. Grind rice and dal separately to smooth batters.
3. Mix batters, add salt. Ferment overnight.
4. Heat dosa pan. Pour batter in circular motion.
5. Drizzle oil and cook until crispy.

name: Idli
ingredients: rice, urad dal, fenugreek seeds, salt
instructions:
1. Soak 3 cups rice, 1 cup urad dal, and 1 tsp fenugreek for 4 hours.
2. Grind to smooth batters separately.
3. Mix batters with salt. Fermit overnight.
4. Pour into idli molds. Steam for 15 minutes.

name: Vada Pav
ingredients: potatoes, bread rolls, green chutney, garlic, ginger, mustard seeds, turmeric, oil
instructions:
1. Boil and mash 4 potatoes. Season with turmeric and salt.
2. Make spiced potato balls.
3. Coat in chickpea flour batter and deep fry.
4. Slit bread rolls. Add vada, chutney, and fried green chilies.

name: Pani Puri
ingredients: puris, potatoes, chickpeas, mint, tamarind, chaat masala, yogurt
instructions:
1. Make small holes in puris.
2. Fill with mashed potatoes and chickpeas.
3. Add mint-tamarind water and yogurt.
4. Serve immediately.

name: Samosa
ingredients: flour, potatoes, peas, cumin, coriander powder, garam masala, oil
instructions:
1. Make dough with flour, oil, and water.
2. Boil and mash potatoes. Mix with peas and spices.
3. Roll dough into triangles. Fill with mixture.
4. Deep fry until golden brown.

name: Aloo Gobi
ingredients: potatoes, cauliflower, onion, tomato, cumin, turmeric, coriander powder, oil
instructions:
1. Cut potatoes and cauliflower into cubes.
2. Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds.
3. Add chopped onion and cook until golden.
4. Add tomatoes and spices. Cook until soft.
5. Add vegetables and 1/2 cup water.
6. Cover and cook for 10 minutes.

name: Baingan Bharta
ingredients: eggplant, onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, garam masala, oil
instructions:
1. Roast whole eggplant on flame until charred.
2. Peel and mash the flesh.
3. Heat oil in a pan. Add onion, ginger, garlic.
4. Sauté until golden. Add tomato and cook until soft.
5. Add mashed eggplant, garam masala, and salt.
6. Cook for 5 minutes.

name: Malai Kofta
ingredients: potatoes, paneer, cashews, cream, onion, tomato, garam masala, oil
instructions:
1. Mash boiled potatoes. Mix with crumbled paneer.
2. Make small balls and deep fry.
3. Heat oil. Add onion and cook until golden.
4. Add tomato puree and garam masala.
5. Add cashew paste and cream.
6. Add fried koftas and simmer for 5 minutes.

name: Navratri Kuttu Ki Puri
ingredients: buckwheat flour, potatoes, rock salt, oil
instructions:
1. Mix buckwheat flour with grated potatoes and rock salt.
2. Add water to make stiff dough.
3. Roll into small discs.
4. Deep fry until crispy and golden.

name: Sabudana Khichdi
ingredients: sago pearls, peanuts, potatoes, cumin, green chilies, lemon, oil
instructions:
1. Soak sago pearls for 2 hours. Boil and cube potatoes.
2. Heat oil. Add cumin and peanuts. Fry until golden.
3. Add potatoes and green chilies. Cook for 2 minutes.
4. Add sago pearls and 1/2 cup water.
5. Cook until pearls become translucent.
6. Add lemon juice and cilantro.

name: Poha
ingredients: flattened rice, potatoes, onions, mustard seeds, turmeric, lemon, oil
instructions:
1. Wash flattened rice and drain excess water.
2. Heat oil. Add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
3. Add chopped onions and potatoes. Cook until golden.
4. Add turmeric and drained poha.
5. Mix gently and cook for 2 minutes.
6. Add lemon juice and cilantro.

name: Upma
ingredients: semolina, vegetables, mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, oil
instructions:
1. Dry roast semolina for 5 minutes. Set aside.
2. Heat oil. Add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
3. Add chopped vegetables and green chilies.
4. Add 2 cups water and bring to boil.
5. Add roasted semolina slowly while stirring.
6. Cook for 3 minutes.

name: Methi Thepla
ingredients: flour, fenugreek leaves, yogurt, turmeric, red chili powder, oil
instructions:
1. Finely chop fresh fenugreek leaves.
2. Mix with flour, yogurt, and spices.
3. Add water to make soft dough.
4. Roll into thin circles.
5. Cook on griddle with oil until golden.

name: Khandvi
ingredients: besan, yogurt, green chilies, ginger, mustard seeds, oil
instructions:
1. Mix besan with yogurt and 2 cups water.
2. Cook on low heat, stirring continuously until thick.
3. Cool and spread on greased tray.
4. Cut into diamonds. Roll in tempered mustard seeds.

name: Dhokla
ingredients: besan, yogurt, ginger, green chilies, eno fruit salt, oil
instructions:
1. Mix besan with yogurt, ginger-green chili paste, and salt.
2. Add water to make thick batter.
3. Add eno fruit salt and mix quickly.
4. Steam for 20 minutes.
5. Temper with mustard seeds and curry leaves.

name: Bhel Puri
ingredients: puffed rice, sev, potatoes, onions, chutneys, lemon
instructions:
1. Mix puffed rice with chopped vegetables.
2. Add sweet and green chutneys.
3. Top with sev and lemon juice.
4. Toss gently and serve immediately.

name: Sev Puri
ingredients: puris, potatoes, onions, chutneys, sev, lemon
instructions:
1. Make small holes in puris.
2. Fill with mashed potatoes and onions.
3. Add chutneys and sev.
4. Sprinkle lemon juice and cilantro.

name: Aloo Tikki
ingredients: potatoes, breadcrumbs, cumin, coriander powder, oil
instructions:
1. Boil and mash potatoes. Mix with breadcrumbs and spices.
2. Make flat patties.
3. Shallow fry until golden brown on both sides.

name: Papdi Chaat
ingredients: papdis, potatoes, yogurt, chutneys, sev
instructions:
1. Arrange papdis on plate.
2. Top with mashed potatoes and yogurt.
3. Add chutneys and sev.
4. Garnish with cilantro.

name: Ragda Pattice
ingredients: potatoes, white peas, pav, garlic, ginger, oil
instructions:
1. Boil white peas with ginger-garlic paste until soft.
2. Mash potatoes and make patties. Fry until golden.
3. Serve patties with ragda and pav.

name: Misal Pav
ingredients: sprouted moth beans, potatoes, farsan, pav, lemon, oil
instructions:
1. Cook sprouted moth beans with masala.
2. Top with boiled potatoes and farsan.
3. Serve with buttered pav and lemon.

name: Vada
ingredients: urad dal, black gram, ginger, green chilies, oil
instructions:
1. Soak urad dal for 4 hours. Grind to smooth batter.
2. Add ginger-green chili paste and salt.
3. Ferment overnight.
4. Deep fry in vada shape until golden.

name: Medu Vada
ingredients: urad dal, black gram, ginger, green chilies, oil
instructions:
1. Soak urad dal for 4 hours. Grind to smooth batter.
2. Add ginger-green chili paste and salt.
3. Ferment overnight.
4. Deep fry in donut shape until golden.

name: Rava Idli
ingredients: semolina, yogurt, ginger, green chilies, oil
instructions:
1. Mix semolina with yogurt and 1 cup water.
2. Add ginger-green chili paste and salt.
3. Pour into idli molds.
4. Steam for 10 minutes.

name: Kerala Appam
ingredients: rice, coconut, yeast, salt
instructions:
1. Grind rice and coconut with water to smooth batter.
2. Add yeast and salt. Ferment overnight.
3. Pour in appachatti and cook until crispy edges form.

name: Puttu
ingredients: rice flour, coconut, salt, banana leaf
instructions:
1. Layer rice flour and grated coconut in puttu maker.
2. Steam for 5 minutes.
3. Serve with kadala curry.

name: Karimeen Pollichathu
ingredients: fish, banana leaf, coconut, green chilies, oil
instructions:
1. Clean and marinate fish with ground coconut spices.
2. Wrap in banana leaf.
3. Grill until cooked through.

name: Kerala Fish Curry
ingredients: fish, coconut, turmeric, tamarind, curry leaves, oil
instructions:
1. Grind coconut with green chilies and cumin.
2. Heat oil. Add curry leaves and ground masala.
3. Add fish pieces, turmeric, and tamarind water.
4. Cook until fish is done.

name: Appam
ingredients: rice, coconut, yeast, salt
instructions:
1. Soak rice for 4 hours. Grind with coconut and water.
2. Add yeast and salt. Ferment overnight.
3. Cook in appachatti until crispy edges form.

name: Kerala Parotta
ingredients: flour, oil, egg, water
instructions:
1. Make stiff dough with flour, oil, and water.
2. Knead well and rest for 1 hour.
3. Roll thin and fold with oil.
4. Roll again and cook on griddle.

name: Kerala Beef Fry
ingredients: beef, coconut, black pepper, curry leaves, oil
instructions:
1. Cut beef into small pieces.
2. Grind coconut with black pepper.
3. Heat oil. Add curry leaves and ground masala.
4. Add beef and cook until tender and dry.

name: Kerala Chicken Curry
ingredients: chicken, coconut, onions, curry leaves, oil
instructions:
1. Grind coconut with onions and green chilies.
2. Heat oil. Add curry leaves and ground masala.
3. Add chicken pieces and cook until tender.

name: Kerala Vegetable Stew
ingredients: vegetables, coconut milk, onions, curry leaves, oil
instructions:
1. Heat oil. Add chopped onions and cook until golden.
2. Add vegetables and 1/2 cup water. Cook until tender.
3. Add coconut milk and curry leaves.
4. Simmer for 5 minutes.

name: Kerala Fish Moilee
ingredients: fish, coconut milk, curry leaves, turmeric, oil
instructions:
1. Heat oil. Add curry leaves and sliced onions.
2. Add fish pieces, turmeric, and 1/2 cup water.
3. Cook for 5 minutes.
4. Add coconut milk and simmer for 3 minutes.

name: Kerala Prawn Curry
ingredients: prawns, coconut, onions, curry leaves, oil
instructions:
1. Grind coconut with onions and green chilies.
2. Heat oil. Add curry leaves and ground masala.
3. Add prawns and cook until done.

name: Kerala Egg Roast
ingredients: eggs, coconut, onions, curry leaves, oil
instructions:
1. Hard boil eggs and make slits.
2. Grind coconut with onions and spices.
3. Heat oil. Add curry leaves and ground masala.
4. Add eggs and cook until masala coats eggs.

name: Hyderabadi Biryani
ingredients: basmati rice, goat meat, yogurt, onions, mint, cilantro, biryani masala, saffron, ghee
instructions:
1. Marinate 500g goat meat with yogurt and biryani masala for 2 hours.
2. Cook meat partially with onions, mint, and cilantro.
3. Parboil 2 cups basmati rice with whole spices.
4. Layer meat and rice in heavy-bottomed pan.
5. Top with saffron milk and fried onions.
6. Dum cook covered on low heat for 30 minutes.

name: Mutton Rogan Josh
ingredients: mutton, yogurt, onions, ginger, garlic, Kashmiri chilies, garam masala, oil
instructions:
1. Marinate 500g mutton with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for 1 hour.
2. Heat oil in pressure cooker. Add sliced onions and cook until golden.
3. Add marinated mutton and brown lightly.
4. Add 2 cups water and pressure cook for 20 minutes.
5. Open cooker and cook on high heat until gravy thickens.
6. Garnish with fresh cilantro.

name: Chicken Korma
ingredients: chicken, yogurt, onions, cashews, cream, garam masala, saffron, oil
instructions:
1. Blend 1/2 cup cashews with 1/4 cup water to smooth paste.
2. Marinate 500g chicken with yogurt and garam masala for 30 minutes.
3. Heat oil in pan. Add sliced onions and cook until golden brown.
4. Add marinated chicken and cook until white.
5. Add cashew paste, cream, and 1/2 cup water.
6. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add saffron and cook for 2 minutes.

name: Dal Makhani
ingredients: black lentils, kidney beans, butter, cream, ginger, garlic, garam masala, oil
instructions:
1. Soak 1 cup black lentils and 1/4 cup kidney beans overnight.
2. Pressure cook with salt and turmeric for 20 minutes.
3. Heat butter in pan. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook.
4. Add cooked dal and 1 cup water. Simmer for 30 minutes.
5. Add cream, garam masala, and remaining butter.
6. Cook for 10 minutes on low heat.

name: Shahi Tukda
ingredients: bread, milk, sugar, saffron, pistachios, almonds, ghee
instructions:
1. Deep fry bread slices until golden and crispy.
2. Boil 2 cups milk with sugar and saffron until thick.
3. Dip fried bread in sweet milk mixture.
4. Arrange in serving dish.
5. Pour remaining thick milk over bread.
6. Garnish with chopped pistachios and almonds.

name: Gulab Jamun
ingredients: khoya, flour, baking soda, milk, sugar, cardamom, ghee
instructions:
1. Mix 200g khoya with 2 tbsp flour and baking soda.
2. Knead into soft dough with little milk.
3. Make small balls and deep fry until golden brown.
4. Make sugar syrup with 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup water, and cardamom.
5. Soak fried balls in warm syrup for 30 minutes.

name: Rasmalai
ingredients: milk, sugar, chenna, saffron, pistachios, cardamom
instructions:
1. Boil 1 liter milk and add 2 tbsp lemon juice to curdle.
2. Strain and wash chenna. Knead until smooth.
3. Make small balls and boil in sugar water until cooked.
4. Prepare thick milk by reducing 1 liter milk with sugar.
5. Add saffron and cardamom to reduced milk.
6. Soak cooked balls in sweetened milk. Garnish with pistachios.

name: Kheer
ingredients: rice, milk, sugar, saffron, cardamom, pistachios, almonds
instructions:
1. Wash 1/2 cup rice and cook in 1 liter milk until soft.
2. Add sugar and cook until milk reduces to half.
3. Add crushed cardamom and saffron.
4. Continue cooking until kheer thickens.
5. Garnish with chopped pistachios and almonds.
6. Serve chilled or warm.

name: Litti Chokha
ingredients: flour, sattu, ghee, eggplant, tomato, potato, mustard oil
instructions:
1. Mix 2 cups flour with sattu, ghee, and salt to make dough.
2. Make small balls and bake on tawa until golden.
3. Roast eggplant, tomato, and potato on flame.
4. Peel and mash vegetables. Add mustard oil and spices.
5. Serve baked litti with chokha.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: chickpeas, onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, chole masala, flour, yogurt, oil
instructions:
1. Soak 1 cup chickpeas overnight. Pressure cook until soft.
2. Heat oil. Add chopped onion, ginger, garlic and cook until golden.
3. Add tomato puree, chole masala and cook until oil separates.
4. Add cooked chickpeas and 1 cup water. Simmer for 20 minutes.
5. For bhature: Mix flour with yogurt, oil and salt. Rest for 2 hours.
6. Roll and deep fry until golden and puffed.

name: Paniyaram
ingredients: rice flour, urad dal, yogurt, ginger, green chilies, oil
instructions:
1. Soak 1 cup rice flour and 1/4 cup urad dal for 2 hours.
2. Grind to smooth batter. Add yogurt, ginger, green chilies and salt.
3. Ferment for 3 hours.
4. Heat paniyaram pan. Pour batter in each cavity.
5. Cook until golden brown, adding oil to sides.
6. Serve hot with chutney.

name: Kozhikode Biryani
ingredients: rice, beef, coconut, onions, mint, biryani masala, ghee
instructions:
1. Marinate 500g beef with coconut paste and biryani masala for 1 hour.
2. Cook beef with sliced onions until tender.
3. Parboil 2 cups rice with whole spices.
4. Layer beef and rice in handi.
5. Add ghee and mint leaves on top.
6. Dum cook covered for 25 minutes.

name: Avial
ingredients: mixed vegetables, coconut, yogurt, curry leaves, coconut oil
instructions:
1. Cut 2 cups mixed vegetables into uniform pieces.
2. Cook vegetables with turmeric and salt until tender.
3. Grind coconut with green chilies and cumin.
4. Add ground coconut to cooked vegetables.
5. Add yogurt and cook for 2 minutes.
6. Temper with curry leaves and coconut oil.

name: Kerala Puttu
ingredients: rice flour, coconut, salt, banana leaf
instructions:
1. Steam layers of rice flour and grated coconut in puttu maker.
2. Alternate layers starting and ending with flour.
3. Steam for 5-7 minutes until firm.
4. Serve hot with kadala curry or stew.

name: Pesarattu
ingredients: green gram, rice, ginger, green chilies, oil
instructions:
1. Soak 1 cup green gram and 1/4 cup rice for 4 hours.
2. Grind with ginger, green chilies and salt to smooth batter.
3. Ferment for 2 hours.
4. Heat dosa pan. Pour batter in circular motion.
5. Cook until crispy. Serve with upma podi.

name: Kimchi Fried Rice
ingredients: rice, kimchi, bacon, eggs, green onions, sesame oil, soy sauce
instructions:
1. Heat 2 tbsp sesame oil in a wok or large pan.
2. Add diced bacon and cook until crispy.
3. Add chopped kimchi and stir fry for 2 minutes.
4. Add 3 cups cooked rice and break up any clumps.
5. Add 2 tbsp soy sauce and mix well.
6. Push rice to one side, crack 2 eggs in empty space.
7. Scramble eggs then mix with rice.
8. Garnish with chopped green onions and sesame seeds.

name: Bulgogi
ingredients: beef, soy sauce, sugar, garlic, pear, sesame oil, green onions
instructions:
1. Thinly slice 500g beef (ribeye or sirloin).
2. Grate 1/2 pear and mix with soy sauce, sugar, minced garlic, sesame oil.
3. Marinate beef in mixture for at least 30 minutes.
4. Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan. Add beef and cook until caramelized.
5. Add sliced green onions and cook for 1 minute.
6. Serve with steamed rice.

name: Bibimbap
ingredients: rice, spinach, bean sprouts, carrots, mushrooms, beef, egg, gochujang
instructions:
1. Cook 1 cup rice and set aside.
2. Blanch spinach with sesame oil and salt.
3. Stir fry bean sprouts with soy sauce.
4. Julienne carrots and stir fry with sesame oil.
5. Sauté mushrooms with soy sauce and sesame oil.
6. Fry 200g beef with soy sauce and sesame oil.
7. Fry one egg sunny side up.
8. Arrange all ingredients over rice. Top with egg and gochujang.

name: Pad Thai
ingredients: rice noodles, shrimp, tofu, eggs, bean sprouts, peanuts, tamarind paste
instructions:
1. Soak rice noodles in warm water for 10 minutes.
2. Mix tamarind paste with fish sauce, sugar, and 2 tbsp water.
3. Heat oil in wok. Add scrambled eggs and set aside.
4. Add shrimp and tofu. Cook until shrimp turns pink.
5. Add noodles and sauce mixture. Stir fry for 2 minutes.
6. Add bean sprouts and cooked eggs. Toss well.
7. Garnish with crushed peanuts and lime wedges.

name: Tom Yum Soup
ingredients: shrimp, lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime leaves, mushrooms, fish sauce, chili
instructions:
1. Bruise 2 stalks lemongrass and slice 1 inch galangal.
2. Boil 4 cups water with lemongrass, galangal, and lime leaves for 5 minutes.
3. Add 200g mushrooms and 300g shrimp. Cook for 3 minutes.
4. Add fish sauce, lime juice, and chili paste to taste.
5. Simmer for 2 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

name: Green Curry
ingredients: chicken, green curry paste, coconut milk, Thai eggplant, basil, fish sauce
instructions:
1. Heat 1 cup thick coconut milk in pot until it starts to separate.
2. Add 3 tbsp green curry paste and fry until fragrant.
3. Add 500g chicken pieces and cook until sealed.
4. Add remaining coconut milk and 1 cup water.
5. Add Thai eggplant and simmer for 15 minutes.
6. Add fish sauce, palm sugar, and Thai basil.
7. Cook for 2 minutes. Serve with jasmine rice.

name: Massaman Curry
ingredients: beef, massaman curry paste, coconut milk, potatoes, onions, peanuts, tamarind
instructions:
1. Heat 1 cup coconut milk until it separates. Add 3 tbsp massaman paste.
2. Add 500g beef chunks and cook until browned.
3. Add remaining coconut milk, tamarind paste, and palm sugar.
4. Add cubed potatoes and onions.
5. Simmer covered for 1 hour until beef is tender.
6. Add roasted peanuts in last 10 minutes.
7. Season with fish sauce to taste.

name: Chicken Satay
ingredients: chicken, coconut milk, turmeric, coriander, cumin, peanut sauce
instructions:
1. Cut 500g chicken into thin strips.
2. Mix with coconut milk, turmeric, coriander, and cumin. Marinate 1 hour.
3. Thread chicken onto skewers.
4. Grill until cooked through, basting with marinade.
5. For peanut sauce: blend peanuts, coconut milk, and spices.
6. Simmer sauce for 5 minutes. Serve with satay.

name: Sushi Rolls
ingredients: sushi rice, nori, cucumber, avocado, crab sticks, soy sauce, wasabi
instructions:
1. Cook sushi rice and season with rice vinegar, sugar, and salt.
2. Place nori on bamboo mat. Spread rice evenly, leaving 1 inch border.
3. Arrange cucumber, avocado, and crab sticks in line.
4. Roll tightly using mat. Slice into 8 pieces with wet knife.
5. Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.

name: Ramen
ingredients: ramen noodles, pork broth, chashu pork, egg, green onions, nori, bamboo shoots
instructions:
1. Boil 4 cups pork broth with soy sauce and mirin for 10 minutes.
2. Cook ramen noodles according to package directions.
3. Soft boil eggs for 6 minutes, cool and peel.
4. Slice chashu pork and blanch bamboo shoots.
5. Place noodles in bowl. Pour hot broth.
6. Top with pork, egg, green onions, nori, and bamboo shoots.

name: Mongolian Beef
ingredients: beef, soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, ginger, green onions, sesame oil
instructions:
1. Slice 500g beef against grain into thin strips.
2. Mix soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, and ginger.
3. Marinate beef for 30 minutes.
4. Heat 2 tbsp oil in wok. Add beef and cook until browned.
5. Add sauce and cook until thickened.
6. Garnish with chopped green onions and sesame seeds.

name: Kung Pao Chicken
ingredients: chicken, peanuts, dried chilies, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, Sichuan peppercorns
instructions:
1. Cube 500g chicken and marinate with soy sauce for 15 minutes.
2. Mix soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and 2 tbsp water.
3. Heat oil in wok. Add dried chilies and Sichuan peppercorns.
4. Add chicken and stir fry until cooked.
5. Add sauce mixture and peanuts.
6. Cook until sauce coats chicken. Garnish with green onions.

name: Beef Noodle Soup
ingredients: beef, noodles, star anise, cinnamon, soy sauce, bok choy, carrots
instructions:
1. Brown 500g beef chunks. Add water, star anise, cinnamon, and soy sauce.
2. Simmer for 2 hours until beef is tender.
3. Cook noodles according to package directions.
4. Blanch bok choy and julienne carrots.
5. Slice beef and strain broth.
6. Place noodles in bowl, add beef and vegetables. Pour hot broth.

name: Mapo Tofu
ingredients: tofu, ground pork, doubanjiang, Sichuan peppercorns, garlic, ginger
instructions:
1. Cube 400g tofu and blanch in salted water.
2. Heat oil in wok. Add ground pork and cook until browned.
3. Add doubanjiang, garlic, and ginger. Cook until fragrant.
4. Add 1 cup water and tofu cubes.
5. Simmer for 5 minutes. Thicken with cornstarch slurry.
6. Sprinkle with ground Sichuan peppercorns.

name: Spring Rolls
ingredients: rice paper, vermicelli, lettuce, herbs, shrimp, mint, cilantro
instructions:
1. Soak rice paper in warm water until soft.
2. Cook vermicelli according to package directions.
3. Arrange lettuce, herbs, cooked shrimp, and vermicelli on paper.
4. Fold sides and roll tightly from bottom to top.
5. Serve with peanut dipping sauce.

name: Hawaiian Pizza
ingredients: pizza dough, ham, pineapple, mozzarella, tomato sauce, oregano
instructions:
1. Roll out pizza dough on floured surface.
2. Spread tomato sauce evenly over dough.
3. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese.
4. Add diced ham and pineapple chunks.
5. Bake at 220°C for 12-15 minutes until crust is golden.
6. Sprinkle with oregano before serving.

name: Caesar Salad
ingredients: romaine lettuce, croutons, parmesan, Caesar dressing, chicken
instructions:
1. Wash and chop romaine lettuce into bite-sized pieces.
2. Grill 300g chicken breast and slice.
3. Toss lettuce with Caesar dressing.
4. Top with grilled chicken, croutons, and shaved parmesan.
5. Add cracked black pepper and serve immediately.

name: Chicken Burger
ingredients: chicken patty, burger bun, lettuce, tomato, onion, mayonnaise, cheese
instructions:
1. Season 200g ground chicken with salt and pepper.
2. Form into patty and cook in pan until golden.
3. Toast burger buns lightly.
4. Spread mayonnaise on bottom bun.
5. Layer lettuce, tomato, onion, chicken patty, and cheese.
6. Top with upper bun and serve with fries.

name: Pasta Alfredo
ingredients: fettuccine, butter, heavy cream, parmesan, garlic, black pepper
instructions:
1. Cook fettuccine according to package directions.
2. Heat 4 tbsp butter in pan. Add minced garlic.
3. Add 1 cup heavy cream and simmer for 2 minutes.
4. Gradually add 1 cup grated parmesan, stirring constantly.
5. Add cooked pasta and toss to coat.
6. Season with black pepper and serve immediately.

name: Tacos
ingredients: corn tortillas, ground beef, lettuce, tomato, cheese, sour cream, salsa
instructions:
1. Brown 300g ground beef with taco seasoning.
2. Warm corn tortillas in dry pan.
3. Fill tortillas with beef, shredded lettuce, and diced tomato.
4. Top with cheese, sour cream, and salsa.
5. Fold and serve with lime wedges.

name: Nachos
ingredients: tortilla chips, cheese, jalapeños, ground beef, sour cream, guacamole
instructions:
1. Arrange tortilla chips on baking sheet.
2. Brown 200g ground beef with taco seasoning.
3. Sprinkle cheese and jalapeños over chips.
4. Bake at 180°C until cheese melts.
5. Top with beef, sour cream, and guacamole.
6. Serve immediately while hot.

name: Fish and Chips
ingredients: white fish, potatoes, beer batter, salt, oil
instructions:
1. Cut 500g white fish into strips. Season with salt.
2. Cut potatoes into thick chips and soak in water.
3. Make batter with flour, beer, and salt.
4. Pat fish dry and coat in batter.
5. Deep fry fish until golden and crispy.
6. Fry chips until golden. Season with salt.

name: Chicken Wings
ingredients: chicken wings, soy sauce, honey, garlic, ginger, sesame oil
instructions:
1. Cut 500g chicken wings at joints.
2. Mix soy sauce, honey, garlic, ginger, and sesame oil.
3. Marinate wings for 1 hour.
4. Bake at 200°C for 25 minutes, turning once.
5. Brush with remaining marinade in last 5 minutes.
6. Garnish with sesame seeds.

name: Steak
ingredients: beef steak, salt, black pepper, olive oil, butter, garlic, rosemary
instructions:
1. Season 300g steak with salt and pepper. Let come to room temperature.
2. Heat olive oil in cast iron pan until smoking.
3. Add steak and sear for 3-4 minutes per side.
4. Add butter, garlic, and rosemary. Baste steak.
5. Cook to desired doneness. Rest for 5 minutes.
6. Slice against grain and serve.

name: Fried Chicken
ingredients: chicken pieces, flour, buttermilk, paprika, garlic powder, oil
instructions:
1. Cut 1 whole chicken into 8 pieces.
2. Soak in buttermilk with salt and pepper for 2 hours.
3. Mix flour with paprika, garlic powder, and salt.
4. Dredge chicken in seasoned flour.
5. Deep fry at 175°C until golden and cooked through.
6. Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

name: Mac and Cheese
ingredients: macaroni, cheddar cheese, butter, milk, flour, salt, pepper
instructions:
1. Cook macaroni according to package directions.
2. Make roux with 4 tbsp butter and 4 tbsp flour.
3. Gradually add 2 cups milk, whisking constantly.
4. Add 2 cups grated cheddar cheese.
5. Stir until cheese melts and sauce thickens.
6. Mix with pasta and season with salt and pepper.

name: Pizza Margherita
ingredients: pizza dough, tomato sauce, mozzarella, basil, olive oil, salt
instructions:
1. Roll out pizza dough on floured surface.
2. Spread tomato sauce evenly, leaving border.
3. Tear mozzarella and distribute over sauce.
4. Bake at 250°C for 10-12 minutes until crust is golden.
5. Tear fresh basil leaves over hot pizza.
6. Drizzle with olive oil and sea salt.

name: Lasagna
ingredients: lasagna sheets, ground beef, ricotta, mozzarella, tomato sauce, basil
instructions:
1. Brown 300g ground beef with garlic and onion.
2. Add tomato sauce and simmer for 20 minutes.
3. Mix ricotta with egg and parmesan.
4. Layer sauce, sheets, ricotta, and mozzarella in baking dish.
5. Repeat layers, ending with cheese on top.
6. Bake at 180°C for 45 minutes.

name: Spaghetti Bolognese
ingredients: spaghetti, ground beef, tomatoes, onion, garlic, basil, parmesan
instructions:
1. Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
2. Brown 300g ground beef with chopped onion and garlic.
3. Add canned tomatoes and simmer for 30 minutes.
4. Season with salt, pepper, and fresh basil.
5. Drain pasta and toss with sauce.
6. Serve with grated parmesan cheese.

name: Chicken Teriyaki
ingredients: chicken thighs, soy sauce, mirin, sugar, ginger, garlic, sesame seeds
instructions:
1. Cut 500g chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces.
2. Mix soy sauce, mirin, sugar, ginger, and garlic.
3. Marinate chicken for 30 minutes.
4. Cook chicken in pan until golden and caramelized.
5. Add sauce and cook until thickened.
6. Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.

name: Beef Bulgogi
ingredients: beef, soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, garlic, pear, green onions
instructions:
1. Freeze 500g beef for 30 minutes then slice paper-thin.
2. Grate 1/2 Asian pear and mix with soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, garlic.
3. Marinate beef for 1 hour.
4. Cook in hot oiled pan until caramelized.
5. Add green onions and cook for 1 minute.
6. Serve with steamed rice.

name: Japchae
ingredients: sweet potato starch noodles, beef, spinach, carrots, soy sauce, sesame oil
instructions:
1. Soak sweet potato noodles in warm water for 10 minutes.
2. Stir fry beef with soy sauce. Set aside.
3. Blanch spinach and stir fry carrots with sesame oil.
4. Cook noodles and drain.
5. Mix noodles with vegetables, beef, and seasonings.
6. Garnish with sesame seeds.

name: Fried Rice
ingredients: rice, eggs, vegetables, soy sauce, sesame oil, green onions
instructions:
1. Heat oil in wok. Scramble 2 eggs and set aside.
2. Add diced vegetables and stir fry for 2 minutes.
3. Add 3 cups cooked rice and break up clumps.
4. Add soy sauce and sesame oil. Mix well.
5. Add scrambled eggs and green onions.
6. Stir fry for 1 minute and serve.

name: Chicken Katsu
ingredients: chicken breast, panko breadcrumbs, flour, egg, tonkatsu sauce, oil
instructions:
1. Pound 2 chicken breasts to 1/2 inch thickness.
2. Season with salt and pepper.
3. Dredge in flour, dip in egg, coat with panko.
4. Deep fry at 170°C until golden and cooked through.
5. Slice and serve with tonkatsu sauce.

name: Beef Rendang
ingredients: beef, coconut milk, rendang paste, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves
instructions:
1. Cut 500g beef into chunks.
2. Heat 2 cups coconut milk until it separates.
3. Add rendang paste, lemongrass, and lime leaves.
4. Add beef and simmer for 2 hours until tender.
5. Continue cooking until sauce thickens and darkens.
6. Serve with steamed rice.

name: Nasi Goreng
ingredients: rice, shrimp, eggs, sweet soy sauce, kecap manis, chili paste
instructions:
1. Heat oil in wok. Scramble 2 eggs and set aside.
2. Add chopped shrimp and cook until pink.
3. Add 3 cups cooked rice and break up clumps.
4. Add sweet soy sauce and chili paste. Mix well.
5. Add scrambled eggs and cook for 1 minute.
6. Garnish with fried shallots and cucumber.

name: Chicken Satay
ingredients: chicken, coconut milk, turmeric, coriander, cumin, peanut sauce
instructions:
1. Cut 500g chicken into thin strips.
2. Mix with coconut milk, turmeric, coriander, and cumin. Marinate 1 hour.
3. Thread chicken onto skewers.
4. Grill until cooked through, basting with marinade.
5. For peanut sauce: blend peanuts, coconut milk, and spices.
6. Simmer sauce for 5 minutes. Serve with satay.

name: Laksa
ingredients: rice noodles, coconut milk, laksa paste, shrimp, tofu, bean sprouts
instructions:
1. Cook rice noodles according to package directions.
2. Heat coconut milk with laksa paste until fragrant.
3. Add 300g shrimp and 200g tofu cubes. Cook until done.
4. Add bean sprouts and cook for 1 minute.
5. Divide noodles among bowls. Pour soup over.
6. Garnish with hard-boiled egg and cilantro.

name: Beef Shawarma
ingredients: beef, shawarma spices, pita bread, garlic sauce, pickles, tomatoes
instructions:
1. Slice 500g beef against grain into thin strips.
2. Marinate with shawarma spices for 1 hour.
3. Cook in hot pan until browned and cooked through.
4. Warm pita bread and slice open.
5. Fill with beef, tomatoes, and pickles.
6. Drizzle with garlic sauce and serve.

name: Falafel
ingredients: chickpeas, parsley, cilantro, garlic, cumin, tahini sauce
instructions:
1. Soak 1 cup chickpeas overnight. Drain and rinse.
2. Blend chickpeas with parsley, cilantro, garlic, and cumin.
3. Form into small balls and deep fry until golden.
4. For tahini sauce: blend tahini, lemon juice, and garlic.
5. Thin with water to desired consistency.
6. Serve falafel in pita with tahini sauce.
